result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J. Miller

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
ADA Barnett appears; Deft appears pro se; Plea hearing set;
Plea hearing on July 25, 2022 at 03:20 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 24, 2022 at 11:20 am.

Includes 22CM527 & 20CM596.  No contact with victim(s): Lincoln Elementary School. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  No possession of drug paraphernalia. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Case Called: 2:18 pm
INCLUDES 22CM527 & 20CM596.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett in person. Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, pro se.
COURT QUASHES WARRANT.

VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

BOND: 
$500.00 Signature Bond to cover both files. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): Lincoln Elementary School.
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- No possession of drug paraphernalia. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

PTC 06/24 @ 11:20 am
